ygData.subject: Re: Necro balancing
ygData.msgSnippet: Heh you know whats funny? I bet most necros will quit about 34-43 when you have a very very long and depressing dry spot. They are powerful in the end but it
ygData.messageBody:
Heh you know whats funny? I bet most necros will quit about 34-43 when you
have a very very long and depressing dry spot. They are powerful in the end
but it doesn't mean we don't have to work for it.

Naeeldar

-----Original Message-----
From: Ryan Honeyman <honeyman@...>
To: eqbards@onelist.com <eqbards@onelist.com>
Date: Friday, February 04, 2000 10:52 AM
Subject: Re: [eqbards] Necro balancing


>From: Ryan Honeyman <honeyman@...>
>
>> Interesting that you pick one of the few classes that didn't stage a sit
>> in as they ultimate in whining. From my direct experience, Warriors were
>> way less whiny than Druids and Necros were, most Warriors I started out
>> with back in March picked the more direct route of just not playing
>> Warriors any more (for real, not just threatened to)
>
> This isn't an attack against younger people, however look at the
> average age of druids/necros. Druids/Necros are two of the most
> powerful solo'ing classes in the game (the powerleveler's dream
> if you will). It's only fitting that those immature very young
> powergaming types, a stereotype of both classes mind you, would
> whine much like a child who just had his lollipop taken from him.
>
> Younger people (< 16 yr old) need and want attention, and in EQ
> the majority of the attention comes when you are powerful (with
> items or level). I think both these classes represent the power
> of the game to those people. Just my take on it, and this clearly
> doesn't fit all the players, as I know we have 12 yr old Bards and
> I know some 30 yr old Necros.
>
> Harmonic.
>
>
